channel.title: [For school, not homework] Student Council Utility [From scratch]
channel.description:
[center][IMG]http://img132.imageshack.us/img132/9636/studentcouncilutilitylo.png[/img][/center]
Well, since I am part of the student council in my school, I decided to make this 'utility' for updates of the student council. Thing is, I wanna be 'unique' and make a server to client connection, so I gotta learn networking. That's the challenge. This is fully for my education, and I'm going to try my best to make it happen. Once I learn networking, I could do much more on RSPS than I previously could.
[b]Networking Choice: NIO [i](Not IO, Netty, or MINA)[/i][/b]
Why? Because I find NIO to be the perfect choice for me to do more in RSPS. I'm going to make this open source. Why? Because I'd like [b]YOU[/b] guys to give me advice. I'm very non-native to networking, so maybe you guys could guide me to the right step.
[b]SCU - Student Council Utility: https://github.com/Arham4/SCU[/b]
You guys maybe are thinking, [quote="You"]Wow, school thing in mopar.[/quote] But in all honesty, I don't care. I don't want to do this for the school, I want to do this for my own benefit of learning the basics of networking. So please, constructive criticism and advice surely is appreciated.
#fameinschoolbyteachersandprincipal
Credits:
[ul][li]AtomicInt_ <3[/li] [li]Student Council[/li][/ul]

item.title: [For school, not homework] Student Council Utility [From scratch]
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Taharok:

All I have to say is, why not learn NIO? It’s becoming the standard for IO in Java and is tremendously useful to know. If you spend your time learning classic IO, you’re basically just learning deprecated APIs. If this project is surely only for academic purposes, I definitely advise you go with NIO.

You think so? Alright, lemme change this.

Read full topic

item.title: [For school, not homework] Student Council Utility [From scratch]
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

HcoJustin:

It really doesn’t matter in a small scale project like this, but its not really a good habit to have

It’s not really a good or bad habit, it’s just a different workflow. Some projects are developed like this (Rails and Netty are two that I keep an eye on that are like this), others use the workflow of keeping master stable and then doing all development in feature branches.

Read full topic

item.title: [For school, not homework] Student Council Utility [From scratch]

[quote=“Graham, post:10, topic:481008”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=599246.msg4212144#msg4212144 date=1359727046]
and why are you working directly out of the master branch?
[/quote]

For a single-person project (or even a project with several people), which is in the early stages of development, is this really a problem?[/quote][quote=“sinisoul, post:13, topic:481008”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=599246.msg4212144#msg4212144 date=1359727046]
and why are you working directly out of the master branch?
[/quote]

I agree with Graham on this. Why not?[/quote]

It really doesn’t matter in a small scale project like this, but its not really a good habit to have

item.title: [For school, not homework] Student Council Utility [From scratch]
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:2, topic:481008”]Well, what you should do is determine what sorts of things happen in a student council meeting. I’ve never been to a student council meeting, but all nouns should be made into objects.

You might also consider using a SQL database.[/quote]

Huh?

Lin:

To be honest, I’ve had this same idea and thought it would be cool, but the reality is nobody would use it. Things like this are all about running in a browser so they can be accessed from a PC, phone, etc…

Never liked website stuff.

View all the commits that were done today! https://github.com/Arham4/SCU/commits/master

Alot of things have happened, can’t even say it in this topic.

Read full topic

You might also consider using a SQL database.
